title: Why Na is more reactive than Mg

content.question: Which of the following best helps to explain why <math alttext="N a, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is more reactive with water than <math alttext="M g, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is?

choices.label: <math alttext="N a, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is softer than <math alttext="M g, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The atomic mass of <math alttext="N a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is less than that of <math alttext="M g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The <math alttext="N a with a positive 1 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ion has weaker Coulombic attraction to an anion than the <math alttext="M g with a positive 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ion has.

The first ionization energy of <math alttext="N a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is less than that of <math alttext="M g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The first ionization energy of <math alttext="N a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is less than that of <math alttext="M g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
